Description: Round-topped limestone stela; winged sun-disc with pendent uraei at the top; scene of Osiris enthroned before the deceased who holds an incense-burner in one hand and pours a libation over the central offering-table with the other; below are nine lines of Hieroglyphic text(two blank spaces).
Curator's comments: S. Sharpe, Egyptian Inscriptions from the British Museum and Other Sources, London 1837, pl. 3. P. Munro, Die spätägyptischen Totenstelen, Glückstadt 1973, p. 340. J. Quaegebeur, Chronique d'Egypte 49 (1974), 69 [22]. J. Ray, Journal of Egyptian Archaeology 66 (1980), pp.170-171. E.A.E. Reymond, From the Records of a Priestly Family from Memphis I, Ägyptologische Abhandlungen 38, Wiesbaden 1981, p. 95-103, pl. 7. Cleopatra's Egypt: Age of the Ptolemies, Brooklyn 1988, pp. 229-230 [121]. C. Maystre, Les grands prêtres de Ptah de Memphis (OBO 113), Göttingen 1992, p.400.
Bibliographic references: Brooklyn 1988 / Cleopatra's Egypt: Age of the Ptolemies (no. 121)
